CVE-2016-0634.title: Bash: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201612-39
CVE-2016-0634.subTitle: A vulnerability in Bash could potentially lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2016-0634.background: Bash is the standard GNU Bourne Again SHell.
CVE-2016-0634.body: A vulnerability was found in the way Bash expands $HOSTNAME. Injecting malicious code into $HOSTNAME could cause it to run each time Bash expands \h in the prompt string.
CVE-2016-0634.extra: A remote attacker controlling the system’s hostname (i.e. via DHCP) could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-0701.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201601-05
CVE-2016-0701.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, allowing remote attackers to disclose sensitive information and complete weak handshakes.
CVE-2016-0701.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2016-0701.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the upstream advisory and CVE identifiers referenced below for details. Note that the list includes CVE identifiers for an older OpenSSL Security Advisory (3 Dec 2015) for which we have not issued a GLSA before.
CVE-2016-0701.extra: A remote attacker could disclose a server’s private DH exponent, or complete SSLv2 handshakes using ciphers that have been disabled on the server.

CVE-2016-0702.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-15
CVE-2016-0702.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst allowing remote attackers to decrypt TLS sessions.
CVE-2016-0702.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2016-0702.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL, the worst being a cross-protocol attack called DROWN that could lead to the decryption of TLS sessions. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-0702.extra: A remote attacker could decrypt TLS sessions by using a server supporting SSLv2 and EXPORT cipher suites as a Bleichenbacher RSA padding oracle, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information from memory and (in rare circumstances) recover RSA keys.

CVE-2016-0718.title: Expat: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-21
CVE-2016-0718.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Expat, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-0718.background: Expat is a set of XML parsing libraries.
CVE-2016-0718.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Expat. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-0718.extra: A remote attacker, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted XML file, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition. This attack could also be used against automated systems that arbitrarily process XML files.

CVE-2016-0729.title: Xerces-C++: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-46
CVE-2016-0729.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xerces-C++, the worst of which may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-0729.background: Xerces-C++ is a validating XML parser written in a portable subset of C++.
CVE-2016-0729.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xerces-C++. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-0729.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-0736.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-36
CVE-2016-0736.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Apache, the worst of which could lead to a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2016-0736.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2016-0736.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache. Please review the CVE identifiers, upstream Apache Software Foundation documentation, and HTTPoxy website referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-0736.extra: A remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service condition via multiple vectors or response splitting and cache pollution. Additionally, an attacker could intercept unsecured (HTTP) transmissions via the HTTPoxy vulnerability.

CVE-2016-0739.title: libssh and libssh2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201606-12
CVE-2016-0739.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libssh and libssh2, the worst of which allows remote attackers to cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2016-0739.background: libssh is a mulitplatform C library implementing the SSHv2 and SSHv1 protocol on client and server side.
CVE-2016-0739.body: libssh and libssh2 both have a bits/bytes confusion bug and generate an abnormaly short ephemeral secret for the diffie-hellman-group1 and diffie-hellman-group14 key exchange methods. The resulting secret is 128 bits long, instead of the recommended sizes of 1024 and 2048 bits respectively.
CVE-2016-0739.extra: Additionally, a double free on dangling pointers in initial key exchange packets within libssh could leave dangling pointers in the session crypto structures. It is possible to send a malicious kexinit package to eventually cause a server to do a double-free before this fix. This could be used for a Denial of Service attack.

CVE-2016-0740.title: Pillow: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-52
CVE-2016-0740.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Pillow, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-0740.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Pillow. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-0740.extra: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application, or obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2016-0777.title: OpenSSH: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201601-01
CVE-2016-0777.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSH, allowing attackers to leak client memory to a server, including private keys.
CVE-2016-0777.background: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol implementation that includes SFTP client and server support.
CVE-2016-0777.body: Qualys have reported two issues in the “roaming” code included in the OpenSSH client, which provides undocumented, experimental support for resuming SSH connections. An OpenSSH client could be tricked into leaking parts of its memory to a malicious server. Furthermore, a buffer overflow can be exploited by a malicious server, but its exploitation requires non-default options and is mitigated due to another bug.
CVE-2016-0777.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a specially crafted OpenSSH server, possibly resulting in the disclosure of the user’s private keys. Users with private keys that are not protected by a passphrase are advised to generate new keys if they have connected to an SSH server they don’t fully trust.

CVE-2016-0778.title: OpenSSH: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201601-01
CVE-2016-0778.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSH, allowing attackers to leak client memory to a server, including private keys.
CVE-2016-0778.background: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol implementation that includes SFTP client and server support.
CVE-2016-0778.body: Qualys have reported two issues in the “roaming” code included in the OpenSSH client, which provides undocumented, experimental support for resuming SSH connections. An OpenSSH client could be tricked into leaking parts of its memory to a malicious server. Furthermore, a buffer overflow can be exploited by a malicious server, but its exploitation requires non-default options and is mitigated due to another bug.
CVE-2016-0778.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a specially crafted OpenSSH server, possibly resulting in the disclosure of the user’s private keys. Users with private keys that are not protected by a passphrase are advised to generate new keys if they have connected to an SSH server they don’t fully trust.

CVE-2016-0787.title: libssh and libssh2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201606-12
CVE-2016-0787.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libssh and libssh2, the worst of which allows remote attackers to cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2016-0787.background: libssh is a mulitplatform C library implementing the SSHv2 and SSHv1 protocol on client and server side.
CVE-2016-0787.body: libssh and libssh2 both have a bits/bytes confusion bug and generate an abnormaly short ephemeral secret for the diffie-hellman-group1 and diffie-hellman-group14 key exchange methods. The resulting secret is 128 bits long, instead of the recommended sizes of 1024 and 2048 bits respectively.
CVE-2016-0787.extra: Additionally, a double free on dangling pointers in initial key exchange packets within libssh could leave dangling pointers in the session crypto structures. It is possible to send a malicious kexinit package to eventually cause a server to do a double-free before this fix. This could be used for a Denial of Service attack.

CVE-2016-10087.title: libpng: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201701-74
CVE-2016-10087.subTitle: A null pointer dereference in libpng might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-10087.background: libpng is a standard library used to process PNG (Portable Network Graphics) images. It is used by several programs, including web browsers and potentially server processes.
CVE-2016-10087.body: A null pointer dereference was discovered in libpng in the png_push_save_buffer function. In order to be vulnerable, an application has to load a text chunk into the PNG structure, then delete all text, then add another text chunk to the same PNG structure, which seems to be an unlikely sequence, but it is possible.
CVE-2016-10087.extra: A remote attacker, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted PNG file, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2016-10109.title: PCSC-Lite: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201702-01
CVE-2016-10109.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in PCSC-Lite, the worst of which could lead to privilege escalation.
CVE-2016-10109.background: PCSC-Lite is a middleware to access a smart card using the SCard API (PC/SC).
CVE-2016-10109.body: The SCardReleaseContext function normally releases resources associated with the given handle (including “cardsList”) and clients should cease using this handle. However, a malicious client can make the daemon invoke SCardReleaseContext and continue issuing other commands that use “cardsList”, resulting in a use-after-free. When SCardReleaseContext is invoked multiple times it additionally results in a double-free of “cardsList”.
CVE-2016-10109.extra: A local attacker could use a malicious client to connect to pcscd’s Unix socket, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition or privilege escalation since the daemon is running as root.

CVE-2016-1248.title: Vim, gVim: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201701-29
CVE-2016-1248.subTitle: A vulnerability has been found in Vim and gVim concerning how certain modeline options are treated.
CVE-2016-1248.background: Vim is an efficient, highly configurable improved version of the classic ‘vi’ text editor. gVim is the GUI version of Vim.
CVE-2016-1248.body: Vim and gVim do not properly validate values for the ‘filetype’, ‘syntax’, and ‘keymap’ options.
CVE-2016-1248.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted file using Vim/gVim with certain modeline options enabled possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2016-1503.title: dhcpcd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201606-07
CVE-2016-1503.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in dhcpcd allowing remote attackers to possibly execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2016-1503.background: A fully featured, yet light weight RFC2131 compliant DHCP client
CVE-2016-1503.body: A heap overflow can be triggered via malformed DHCP responses in the print_option (via dhcp_envoption1) due to incorrect option length values. These vulnerabilities could also allow remote attackers to trigger an invalid read/crash via malformed DHCP responses.
CVE-2016-1503.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2016-1504.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2016-1513.title: OpenOffice: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201703-01
CVE-2016-1513.subTitle: A vulnerability in OpenOffice Impress could cause memory corruption.
CVE-2016-1513.background: Apache OpenOffice is an open-source office software suite for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, graphics, databases and more.
CVE-2016-1513.body: An exploitable out-of-bounds vulnerability exists in OpenOffice Impress when handling MetaActions.
CVE-2016-1513.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted OpenDocument Presentation .ODP or Presentation Template .OTP file using OpenOffice Impress, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-1930.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-06
CVE-2016-1930.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Firefox, Thunderbird, Network Security Services (NSS), and NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) with the worst of which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-1930.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, and the Network Security Service (NSS) is a library implementing security features like SSL v.2/v.3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME and X.509 certificates. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2016-1930.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, NSS, NSPR, and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-1930.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impacts.

The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.

CVE-2016-1931.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. CVE-2016-1933.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-06
CVE-2016-1933.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Firefox, Thunderbird, Network Security Services (NSS), and NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) with the worst of which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-1933.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, and the Network Security Service (NSS) is a library implementing security features like SSL v.2/v.3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME and X.509 certificates. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2016-1933.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, NSS, NSPR, and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-1933.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impacts.

CVE-2016-2090.subTitle: A buffer overflow in libbsd might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-2090.background: This library provides useful functions commonly found on BSD systems, and lacking on others like GNU systems, thus making it easier to port projects with strong BSD origins, without needing to embed the same code over and over again on each project.
CVE-2016-2090.body: libbsd contains a buffer overflow in the fgetwln() function. An if statement, which is responsible for checking the necessity to reallocate memory in the target buffer, is off by one therefore an out of bounds write occurs.
CVE-2016-2090.extra: Remote attackers could potentially execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2016-2105.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers and the International Association for Cryptologic Research’s (IACR) paper, “Make Sure DSA Signing Exponentiations Really are Constant-Time” for further details.

CVE-2016-2315.title: Git: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-01
CVE-2016-2315.subTitle: Git contains multiple vulnerabilities that allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-2315.background: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
CVE-2016-2315.body: Git is vulnerable to the remote execution of arbitrary code by cloning repositories with large filenames or a large number of nested trees. Additionally, some protocols within Git, such as git-remote-ext, can execute arbitrary code found within URLs. These URLs that submodules use may come from arbitrary sources (e.g., .gitmodules files in a remote repository), and can effect those who enable recursive fetch. Restrict the allowed protocols to well known and safe ones.
CVE-2016-2315.extra: Remote attackers could execute arbitrary code on both client and server.

CVE-2016-2342.title: Quagga: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201610-03
CVE-2016-2342.subTitle: A buffer overflow in Quagga might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-2342.background: Quagga is a free routing daemon replacing Zebra supporting RIP, OSPF and BGP.
CVE-2016-2342.body: A memcpy function in the VPNv4 NLRI parser of bgp_mplsvpn.c does not properly check the upper-bound length of received Labeled-VPN SAFI routes data, which may allow for arbitrary code execution on the stack.
CVE-2016-2342.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted packet, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-2791.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-06
CVE-2016-2791.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Firefox, Thunderbird, Network Security Services (NSS), and NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) with the worst of which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-2791.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, and the Network Security Service (NSS) is a library implementing security features like SSL v.2/v.3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME and X.509 certificates. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2016-2791.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, NSS, NSPR, and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-2791.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. CVE-2016-2838.background: Mozilla Firefox is a cross-platform web browser from Mozilla. The Mozilla Thunderbird mail client is a redesign of the Mozilla Mail component. The goal is to produce a cross-platform stand-alone mail application using XUL (XML User Interface Language).
CVE-2016-2838.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-2838.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition via multiple vectors.

CVE-2016-2841.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in QEMU. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-2841.extra: Local users within a guest QEMU environment can execute arbitrary code within the host or a cause a Denial of Service condition of the QEMU guest process.

CVE-2016-2849.title: Botan: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-23
CVE-2016-2849.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Botan, the worst of which might allow remote attackers to obtain ECDSA secret keys.
CVE-2016-2849.background: Botan (Japanese for peony) is a cryptography library written in C++11.
CVE-2016-2849.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Botan. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-2849.extra: A remote attacker might obtain ECDSA secret keys via a timing side-channel attack or could possibly bypass TLS policy.

CVE-2016-2851.title: libotr, Pidgin OTR: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201701-10
CVE-2016-2851.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libotr and Pidgin OTR, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-2851.background: Pidgin Off-the-Record (OTR) messaging allows you to have private conversations over instant messaging. libotr is a portable off-the-record messaging library.
CVE-2016-2851.body: Multiple vulnerabilities exist in both libotr and Pidgin OTR. Please review the CVE identifiers for more information.
CVE-2016-2851.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted message, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-3062.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file in an application linked against libav, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the application, a Denial of Service condition or access the content of arbitrary local files.

CVE-2016-5127.background: Chromium is an open-source browser project that aims to build a safer, faster, and more stable way for all users to experience the web.
CVE-2016-5127.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Chromium web browser. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5127.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2016-5131.title: libxml2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-37
CVE-2016-5131.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libxml2, the worst of which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5131.background: libxml2 is the XML (eXtended Markup Language) C parser and toolkit initially developed for the Gnome project.
CVE-2016-5131.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libxml2. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5131.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process a specially crafted XML document, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-5180.title: c-ares: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 201701-28
CVE-2016-5180.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in c-ares might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2016-5180.background: c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests (including name resolves).
CVE-2016-5180.body: A hostname with an escaped trailing dot (such as “hello\.”) would have its size calculated incorrectly leading to a single byte written beyond the end of a buffer on the heap.
CVE-2016-5180.extra: A remote attacker, able to provide a specially crafted hostname to an application using c-ares, could potentially cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-5250.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition via multiple vectors.

CVE-2016-5270.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5270.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition via multiple vectors.

CVE-2016-5300.background: Expat is a set of XML parsing libraries.
CVE-2016-5300.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Expat. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5300.extra: A remote attacker, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted XML file, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition. This attack could also be used against automated systems that arbitrarily process XML files.

CVE-2016-5314.title: libTIFF: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-16
CVE-2016-5314.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libTIFF, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5314.background: The TIFF library contains encoding and decoding routines for the Tag Image File Format. It is called by numerous programs, including GNOME and KDE applications, to interpret TIFF images.
CVE-2016-5314.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libTIFF. Please review the CVE identifier and bug reports referenced for details.
CVE-2016-5314.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted image file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-5407.title: X.Org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201704-03
CVE-2016-5407.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in X.Org server and libraries, the worse of which allowing local attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5407.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in X.Org server and libraries. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5407.extra: A local or remote users can utilize the vulnerabilities to attach to the X.Org session as a user and execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2016-5410.title: Firewalld: Improper authentication methods — GLSA 201701-70
CVE-2016-5410.subTitle: A vulnerability in Firewalld allows firewall configurations to be modified by unauthenticated users.
CVE-2016-5410.background: Firewalld provides a dynamically managed firewall with support for network/firewall zones to define the trust level of network connections or interfaces.
CVE-2016-5410.body: A flaw in Firewalld allows any locally logged in user to tamper with or change firewall settings. This is due to how Firewalld handles authentication via polkit which is not properly applied to 5 particular functions to include: addPassthrough, removePassthrough, addEntry, removeEntry, and setEntries.
CVE-2016-5410.extra: A local attacker could tamper or change firewall settings leading to the additional exposure of systems to include unauthorized remote access.

CVE-2016-5418.title: libarchive: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-03
CVE-2016-5418.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libarchive, the worst of which allows for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5418.background: libarchive is a library for manipulating different streaming archive formats, including certain tar variants, several cpio formats, and both BSD and GNU ar variants.
CVE-2016-5418.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libarchive. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5418.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted archive file possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-5419.title: cURL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-47
CVE-2016-5419.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in cURL, the worst of which could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5419.background: cURL is a tool and libcurl is a library for transferring data with URL syntax.
CVE-2016-5419.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in cURL. Please review the CVE identifiers and bug reports referenced for details.
CVE-2016-5419.extra: Remote attackers could conduct a Man-in-the-Middle attack to obtain sensitive information, cause a Denial of Service condition, or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2016-5573.title: IcedTea: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-43
CVE-2016-5573.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in IcedTea allowing remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability through various vectors.
CVE-2016-5573.background: IcedTea’s aim is to provide OpenJDK in a form suitable for easy configuration, compilation and distribution with the primary goal of allowing inclusion in GNU/Linux distributions.
CVE-2016-5573.body: Various OpenJDK attack vectors in IcedTea, such as 2D, Corba, Hotspot, Libraries, and JAXP, exist which allows remote attackers to affect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of vulnerable systems. Many of the vulnerabilities can only be exploited through sandboxed Java Web Start applications and java applets. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5573.extra: Remote attackers may execute arbitrary code, compromise information, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-5573.title: Oracle JRE/JDK: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201611-04
CVE-2016-5573.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Oracle's JRE and JDK software suites allowing remote attackers to remotely execute arbitrary code, obtain information, and cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2016-5573.background: Java Platform, Standard Edition (Java SE) lets you develop and deploy Java applications on desktops and servers, as well as in today’s demanding embedded environments. Java offers the rich user interface, performance, versatility, portability, and security that today’s applications require.
CVE-2016-5573.body: Multiple vulnerabilities exist in both Oracle’s JRE and JDK. Please review the referenced CVE’s for additional information.
CVE-2016-5573.extra: Remote attackers could gain access to information, remotely execute arbitrary code, or cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2016-5584.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MariaDB and MySQL, the worst of which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-5584.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server. MariaDB is an enhanced, drop-in replacement for MySQL.
CVE-2016-5584.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MariaDB and MySQL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5584.extra: Attackers could execute arbitrary code, escalate privileges, and impact availability via unspecified vectors.

CVE-2016-5611.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in VirtualBox. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-5611.extra: Local attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition, execute arbitrary code, or escalate their privileges.

CVE-2016-6301.title: BusyBox: Denial of service — GLSA 201701-05
CVE-2016-6301.subTitle: A vulnerability in BusyBox might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2016-6301.background: BusyBox is a set of tools for embedded systems and is a replacement for GNU Coreutils.
CVE-2016-6301.body: The recv_and_process_client_pkt function in networking/ntpd.c in BusyBox allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service (CPU and bandwidth consumption) via a forged NTP packet, which triggers a communication loop.
CVE-2016-6301.extra: A remote attacker might send a specially crafted package to a machine running BusyBox ntpd, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-6304.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-16
CVE-2016-6304.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of which allows attackers to conduct a time based side-channel attack.
CVE-2016-6304.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2016-6304.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers and the International Association for Cryptologic Research’s (IACR) paper, “Make Sure DSA Signing Exponentiations Really are Constant-Time” for further details.
CVE-2016-6304.extra: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts. Additionally, a time based side-channel attack may allow a local attacker to recover a private DSA key.

CVE-2016-6305.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-16
CVE-2016-6305.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of which allows attackers to conduct a time based side-channel attack.
CVE-2016-6305.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

CVE-2016-6305.extra: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts. Additionally, a time based side-channel attack may allow a local attacker to recover a private DSA key.

CVE-2016-6306.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

CVE-2016-6306.extra: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts. Additionally, a time based side-channel attack may allow a local attacker to recover a private DSA key.

CVE-2016-6313.title: GnuPG: RNG output is predictable — GLSA 201612-01
CVE-2016-6313.subTitle: Due to a design flaw, the output of GnuPG's Random Number Generator (RNG) is predictable.
CVE-2016-6313.background: The GNU Privacy Guard, GnuPG, is a free replacement for the PGP suite of cryptographic software.
CVE-2016-6313.body: A long standing bug (since 1998) in Libgcrypt (see “GLSA 201610-04” below) and GnuPG allows an attacker to predict the output from the standard RNG. Please review the “Entropy Loss and Output Predictability in the Libgcrypt PRNG” paper below for a deep technical analysis.
CVE-2016-6313.extra: An attacker who obtains 580 bytes of the random number from the standard RNG can trivially predict the next 20 bytes of output.

CVE-2016-6313.title: libgcrypt: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-04
CVE-2016-6313.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been fixed in libgcrypt,the worst of which results in predictable output from the random number generator.
CVE-2016-6313.background: libgcrypt is a general purpose cryptographic library derived out of GnuPG.
CVE-2016-6313.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libgcrypt. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-6313.extra: Side-channel attacks can leak private key information. A separate critical bug allows an attacker who obtains 4640 bits from the RNG to trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.

CVE-2016-6318.title: CrackLib: Buffer overflow — GLSA 201612-25
CVE-2016-6318.subTitle: A vulnerability in CrackLib could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-6318.background: CrackLib is a library used to enforce strong passwords by comparing user selected passwords to words in chosen word lists.
CVE-2016-6318.body: A stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the FascistGecosUser function of lib/fascist.c.
CVE-2016-6318.extra: A local attacker could set a specially crafted GECOS field value in “/etc/passwd”; possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition, or the escalation of privileges.

CVE-2016-6321.title: Tar: Extract pathname bypass — GLSA 201611-19
CVE-2016-6321.subTitle: A path traversal attack in Tar may lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-6321.background: The Tar program provides the ability to create and manipulate tar archives.
CVE-2016-6321.body: Tar attempts to avoid path traversal attacks by removing offending parts of the element name at extract. This sanitizing leads to a vulnerability where the attacker can bypass the path name(s) specified on the command line.
CVE-2016-6321.extra: The attacker can create a crafted tar archive that, if extracted by the victim, replaces files and directories the victim has access to in the target directory, regardless of the path name(s) specified on the command line.

CVE-2016-6328.title: libexif: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 202007-05
CVE-2016-6328.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libexif, the worst of which could result in the arbitrary execution of code.
CVE-2016-6328.background: libexif is a library for parsing, editing and saving Exif metadata from images.

CVE-2016-6329.title: OpenVPN: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201611-02
CVE-2016-6329.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenVPN, the worst of which allows remote attackers to read encrypted traffic.
CVE-2016-6329.background: OpenVPN is a multi-platform, full-featured SSL VPN solution.
CVE-2016-6329.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenVPN. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-6329.extra: A remote attacker may be able to recover plaintext from encrypted communications.

CVE-2016-6354.title: flex: Potential insecure code generation — GLSA 201701-31
CVE-2016-6354.subTitle: Flex might generate code with a buffer overflow making applications using such scanners vulnerable to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-6354.background: flex is a programming tool used to generate scanners (programs which recognize lexical patterns in text).
CVE-2016-6354.body: A heap-based buffer overflow in the yy_get_next_buffer function in Flex might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving num_to_read.
CVE-2016-6354.extra: Context-dependent attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2016-6491.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in ImageMagick, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-6491.background: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for many image formats.
CVE-2016-6491.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ImageMagick. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-6491.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-6525.title: MuPDF: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201702-12
CVE-2016-6525.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MuPDF, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2016-6525.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MuPDF. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-6525.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF document using MuPDF possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-7052.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-16
CVE-2016-7052.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of which allows attackers to conduct a time based side-channel attack.
CVE-2016-7052.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2016-7052.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers and the International Association for Cryptologic Research’s (IACR) paper, “Make Sure DSA Signing Exponentiations Really are Constant-Time” for further details.
CVE-2016-7052.extra: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts. Additionally, a time based side-channel attack may allow a local attacker to recover a private DSA key.

CVE-2016-7635.extra: A remote attack can use multiple vectors to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service condition.

CVE-2016-8859.title: musl: Integer overflow — GLSA 201701-11
CVE-2016-8859.subTitle: An integer overflow in musl might allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-8859.background: musl is a “libc”, an implementation of the standard library functionality described in the ISO C and POSIX standards, plus common extensions, intended for use on Linux-based systems.
CVE-2016-8859.body: A vulnerability was discovered in musl’s tre_tnfa_run_parallel function buffer overflow logic, due to the incorrect use of integer types and missing overflow checks.
CVE-2016-8859.extra: An attacker, who controls the regular expression and/or string being searched, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2016-9848.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in phpMyAdmin. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9848.extra: A authenticated remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary PHP Code, inject SQL code, or to conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

CVE-2016-9893.title: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-15
CVE-2016-9893.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird the worst of which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-9893.background: Mozilla Firefox is a cross-platform web browser from Mozilla. The Mozilla Thunderbird mail client is a redesign of the Mozilla Mail component. The goal is to produce a cross-platform stand-alone mail application using XUL (XML User Interface Language).
CVE-2016-9893.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9893.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition via multiple vectors.

CVE-2016-9908.title: QEMU: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-49
CVE-2016-9908.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in QEMU, the worst of which could cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2016-9908.background: QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer.
CVE-2016-9908.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in QEMU. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9908.extra: A privileged user/process within a guest QEMU environment can cause a Denial of Service condition against the QEMU guest process or the host.

CVE-2016-9932.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-56
CVE-2016-9932.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, the worst of which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the host system.
CVE-2016-9932.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9932.extra: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, could gain privileges on the host system, cause a Denial of Service condition, or obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2016-9935.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PHP. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9935.extra: An attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code or create a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2016-9941.title: LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201702-24
CVE-2016-9941.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code when connecting to a malicious server.
CVE-2016-9941.background: LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient are cross-platform C libraries that allow you to easily implement VNC server or client functionality in your program.
CVE-2016-9941.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in LibVNCServer and LibVNCClient. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9941.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious VNC server or leverage Man-in-the-Middle attacks to cause the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running a VNC client linked against LibVNCClient.

CVE-2016-9942.title: LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201702-24
CVE-2016-9942.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code when connecting to a malicious server.
CVE-2016-9942.background: LibVNCServer/LibVNCClient are cross-platform C libraries that allow you to easily implement VNC server or client functionality in your program.
CVE-2016-9942.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in LibVNCServer and LibVNCClient. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9942.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious VNC server or leverage Man-in-the-Middle attacks to cause the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running a VNC client linked against LibVNCClient.

CVE-2016-9957.title: Game Music Emu: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201707-02
CVE-2016-9957.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Game Music Emu, the worst of which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2016-9957.background: Game Music Emu is a multi-purpose console music emulator and player library.
CVE-2016-9957.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Game Music Emu. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2016-9957.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted SPC music file, using Game Music Emu or an application linked against the Game Music Emu library, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.
